No data is 100% safe, but we do our best to optimize the security of the app by encryption, not asking for obsolete data and provide you avatar pictures.
What is a meditation and gratitude journal app and how does it work?
How can meditation and gratitude journaling improve my mental health and wellbeing?
Is it possible to track my progress and see improvements in my mental state over time?

Introducing Tara, the mental health app designed to guide you on your journey towards emotional wellness. Named after the goddess of compassion, this app is designed to help those struggling with mental health issues by providing a range of tools to improve emotional well-being. Tara features an animation of a glowing lotus that serves as a guide for breathing exercises to help you relax and focus. In addition, the app provides daily healthy positivity affirmations to encourage a positive outlook on life. And in case of an emotional emergency, the app offers an emergency call button for immediate help. One of the standout features of Tara is the gratitude journal, which encourages users to document happy moments in their life and slowly shift their focus towards positivity. By reflecting on the good things in life, users can cultivate a sense of gratitude and appreciation, which can have a positive impact on overall mental health. The inspiration behind the creation of Tara comes from the loss of friends to depression, anxiety, and suicide. The founder of the app knows that there is no guarantee that Tara will solve all mental health issues, but she hopes that the app can make a positive impact on the world and help at least a little bit. With Tara, users can take proactive steps towards improving their mental health and emotional well-being.

To cover data storage and the service we provide you, as well as feed our developers (they become wild beasts without pizza and Coke ðŸ˜‚), we are forced to request a subscription fee from you. But, please, be assured we try our best to keep it as low as possible.

These terms and conditions apply to the use of the Tara app published in the Google Play Store.
The app is provided to the user solely for private use. Commercial use is prohibited unless expressly permitted.
a) The app offers a subscription model. Users can choose between a monthly subscription for â‚¬5.99 or an annual subscription for â‚¬50.
b) The subscription automatically renews unless it is cancelled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period.
c) Payment is processed through the Google Play Store. Upon cancellation of the subscription, access remains until the end of the already paid period.
d) Refunds for already paid subscription fees are excluded unless required by law.
Changes to the Terms and Conditions
Should any provision of these terms and conditions be invalid or unenforceable, the validity of the remaining provisions shall remain unaffected.
This privacy policy informs you about the type, scope, and purpose of the processing of personal data within our app Tara.
We collect and store the following data:
Email address and password for login
Entries (text, date, image) â€“ stored locally on the device
Contact information (name, mobile number, message) â€“ stored locally on the device
Number of entries per day â€“ stored in Firestore

The email address and password are used for login. The entries serve one of the core functions of the app, the gratitude journal. The contact data (name, mobile number, message) is used for the emergency message function. The number of entries is stored to provide the user with an overview of their behavior in the form of a diagram.
Data is not passed on to third parties unless the user sends a message via the app themselves.
Entries and contact data are stored locally on the user\'s device. Login data is stored on Firebase servers in Germany. The number of entries is stored on Firestore servers in the EU.
We use Firebase Analytics and Crashlytics to monitor the performance of the app.
The app offers users the option to export their entries and send them by email as a PDF to a person of their choice. After successful export, all exported entries are deleted from the user\'s device.

Our app uses the Unsplash API to provide random images and a self-developed Google Sheets API to provide quotes. When using these APIs, no personal data of the user is transmitted to Unsplash or Google Sheets.
Users have the right to information about the stored data as well as the right to deletion of this data.
